content: Hi, everyone. I'm new to contributing to the compiler, and right now I have two open pull requests, one that's waiting on review and one that's waiting on Bors. I wanted to start working on another issue in the meantime, but I also don't want to submit too many pull requests and take up reviewers' time. As a general rule, how many open pull requests should one contributor at a time? Is there any limit, or should I feel free to make more pull requests?
Nope, feel free to make more :) the only time I would worry about it is when many PRs build on top of each other - in that case consider combining them into one PR with separate logical commits
If it makes you feel better, I at one point had like 12 PRs open at once lol
Many small PRs are easier and faster to get through given that reviews are usually a bottleneck and reviewing small independent pieces is just more straightforward.
